title: A Room in the Governor's Residence, Hermannstadt (?)
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; York House, Inc., New York, 1987
medium: Brush and watercolor and gouache with accents of gold paint and gum arabic
description: This opulent salon is apparently unused: the tables are without objects and the bookcase is bare. Formal red and white striped curtains, tasselled pelmets and lace undercurtains lend majesty to the room. A painted blind in the chinoiserie style is at the center window. The walls are hung with a coral patterned fabric. Acanthus leaves are interspersed with bouquets of roses on the coral ground of the carpet. Ornaments are limited to two paintings, one featuring a Madonna and Child; a gilt-bronze clock under a glass dome; and an inkwell.
name: Drawing
